descriptions: No attempt to graph the proportional relationship.
Graphs a relationship, but it is not proportional or contains significant errors.
Graphs a proportional relationship with minor inaccuracies.
Accurately graphs a proportional relationship, but the axes are not labeled or the scale is inappropriate.
Accurately graphs a proportional relationship with correctly labeled axes and appropriate scale.
Accurately and neatly graphs a proportional relationship with correctly labeled axes, appropriate scale, and a clear indication of the unit rate (slope).
Does not attempt to interpret the unit rate or slope.
Attempts to interpret the unit rate or slope, but the interpretation is incorrect.
Identifies the unit rate or slope, but does not connect it to the graph or relationship.
Correctly identifies the unit rate as the slope, but struggles to explain its meaning in the context of the problem.
Correctly interprets the unit rate as the slope of the graph and explains its meaning in the context of the problem.
Clearly and concisely interprets the unit rate as the slope, explaining its significance and implications in the context of the problem with detailed reasoning.
No attempt to compare the proportional relationships.
Attempts to compare the relationships, but the comparison is flawed or incomplete.
Compares the relationships, but struggles to use the information presented in different formats (graph vs. equation).
Compares the relationships using information from both the graph and equation, but the reasoning is not clear.
Effectively compares the two proportional relationships presented in different ways and provides clear reasoning.

Insightfully compares the two relationships, clearly articulating the differences, similarities, and providing a comprehensive explanation of which has a greater speed and why, using both the graph and equation.
